direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods modify the state of the iterator but require the 'next' method to be called first.
Both methods reset or modify the internal state of the iterator, affecting subsequent operations.
The 'remove' method depends on the 'next' method being called first to function correctly.
Both methods interact with the internal state of the iterator and can throw NoSuchElementException.
Both methods throw UnsupportedOperationException, indicating similar exception handling patterns.
